docs.lead_paragraph: Two Florida doctors who received the nation’s highest Medicare reimbursements in 2012 are both major contributors to Democratic Party causes.

headline.main: Political Ties of Top Billers for Medicare
headline.print_headline: Political Ties of Top Billers for Medicare

docs.abstract: Health and Human Services Dept report shows that Florida doctors Salomon Melgen and Asad Qamar, who received the nation's highest Medicare reimbursements in 2012, are both major contributors to Democratic Party causes; Melgen and Qamar, subjects of investigations for fraudulent billing, defend their payments, citing unique conditions at their practices.
docs.snippet: Two Florida doctors who received the nation’s highest Medicare reimbursements in 2012 are both major contributors to Democratic Party causes.

byline.contributor: Frances Robles reported from Miami, and Eric Lipton from Washington. Michael Strickland contributed research.
byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES and ERIC LIPTON

docs.lead_paragraph: Three lesbian couples facing urgent health issues sued on Wednesday to force North Carolina to acknowledge their same-sex marriages and allow access to insurance, tax and inheritance benefits.

headline.main: Detroit Creditor Shows Court Four Offers for City's Art
headline.print_headline: Detroit Creditor Shows Court Four Offers for City’s Art

docs.abstract: With city and state officials pushing to keep Detroit’s bankruptcy moving forward toward resolution, a bond insurer threw an obstacle on to the road on Wednesday: four rival offers for the treasures in the city’s art museum.
docs.snippet: With city and state officials pushing to keep Detroit’s bankruptcy moving forward toward resolution, a bond insurer threw an obstacle on to the road on Wednesday: four rival offers for the treasures in the city’s art museum.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some doctors who take Medicare received millions of dollars each in a single year, according to newly released data that provides an unprecedented look at the practice of medicine in the United States.

headline.main: Sliver of Medicare Doctors Get Big Share of Payouts
headline.print_headline: Sliver of Medicare Doctors Get Big Share of Payouts

docs.abstract: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services is making available to the public the most detailed data about Medicare ever released in the program's nearly 50-year history; data provides an unprecedented look at the practice of medicine across the country, and will provide consumers with an ability to compare doctors and treatments in a way they have never before had.
docs.snippet: Some doctors who take Medicare received millions of dollars each in a single year, according to newly released data that provides an unprecedented look at the practice of medicine in the United States.
